data.title: Wellness Workdays announces 2026 conference with leading experts in wellness, safety, psychology, leadership.
data.description: The upcoming 13th Annual Emerging Trends in Workplace Wellness Conference, set to take place in Boston on February 27, 2026, will showcase prominent figures in the field of workplace wellness. The event will focus on various topics including construction safety, positive psychology, leadership, and organizational performance. Wellness Workdays, a notable provider of workplace wellness solutions, is hosting the conference. This event is expected to draw a significant number of attendees seeking insights and expertise in these crucial areas.

data.title: AI reshaping US market; favoring low AI exposure sectors like retail, energy over sectors with high labor costs.
data.description: Investors are shifting focus in the U.S. market towards industries with lower exposure to AI-driven labor automation over the past six months. Goldman Sachs' analysis shows that sectors like software, communication, and professional services are more vulnerable to AI disruption due to high labor costs as a percentage of total revenue. On the other hand, industries like retail goods, energy, and semiconductors have lower labor-cost shares and are less exposed to AI impact. This trend highlights a widening performance gap between asset-heavy, goods-producing sectors and asset-light, service-oriented industries. While AI can boost productivity, it also poses challenges such as margin compression and labor displacement.

data.title: Healthpeak Properties, Inc. filed a reg statement with SEC for Janus Living Inc.'s public offering of Class A-1 shares.
data.description: Healthpeak Properties, Inc. revealed that Janus Living, Inc., a specialized senior housing REIT, has submitted a registration statement (Form S-11) with the SEC for a potential IPO of their Class A-1 common stock. The IPO is contingent upon market conditions, regulatory authorizations, and financial arrangements being finalized.

data.title: Bitcoin's decline (##%) contrasts gold's rise, revealing shifts in the crypto world. Will growing money supply boost BTC's value amid AI, tech, and gold surge?
data.description: As the global market fluctuates, investors are showing varied interest in different assets. While Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies remain popular, attention has also shifted towards AI, tech stocks, and gold. This shift in focus comes as the global money supply continues to increase. This has prompted questions on whether Bitcoin will benefit from this trend. With Bitcoin reaching a market cap of approximately $1 trillion, its performance remains of interest to investors exploring diverse opportunities in the market.

data.title: Pulsar Helium closes fundraising round. Important details restricted for release.
data.description: The following announcement contains restricted information and is not intended for release, publication, or distribution in Australia, Japan, or the Republic of South Africa. It is also not to be transmitted, distributed, or sent to any national, resident, or citizen of these countries or any jurisdiction where such actions could violate local securities laws.

data.title: Azitra, Inc. reports 2025 financial results, focusing on precision dermatology therapies. ($AZTR)
data.description: In Branford, Connecticut on February 27, 2026, Azitra, Inc. (NYSE American: AZTR), a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company specializing in precision dermatology treatments, disclosed its financial performance for the fiscal year concluding on December 31, 2025.

data.title: DaBella appoints Chief Process Officer to strengthen infrastructure for national growth, aims for sustained expansion.
data.description: Today in Austin, Texas, DaBella revealed the addition of a Chief Process Officer to its executive leadership team, aiming to enhance operational efficiency, infrastructure scalability, and national growth. This move underscores the company's dedication to solidifying its position in the market and pursuing further expansion opportunities.

data.title: OpGen, Inc. (OTC: OPGN) rebrands as CapForce Inc. to focus on fintech sectors. Ticker symbol to change to "CFOR."
data.description: On February 27, 2026, CapForce Inc. (formerly OpGen, Inc.) announced its rebranding and name change, aimed at aligning with its strategic shift towards the digital investment banking and financial technology sectors. The company's new name, CapForce, signifies the "Force of Capital," underlining its vision as a fintech-powered investment bank that leverages capital markets to empower global mid-sized high growth companies. CapForce seeks to help these companies transcend the small-cap space and advance to the mid-cap or large-cap realm. The company anticipates changing its ticker symbol to "CFOR" to complement its new identity.

data.title: Avalon GloboCare closes $9.75M private placement, $3.25M upfront with $6.5M potential from warrants.
data.description: An initial amount of $3.25 million was provided, with the potential for up to approximately $6.5 million in total proceeds if all warrants are exercised.

data.title: Public Service Company of NM declared a $1.145 quarterly dividend per share on 4.58% series of preferred stock.
data.description: On February 27, 2026, in Albuquerque, New Mexico, the Board of Directors of Public Service Company of New Mexico, a subsidiary of TXNM Energy (NYSE: TXNM), announced the approval of a quarterly dividend of $1.145 per share for the 4.58 percent series of cumulative preferred stock. This decision highlights the company's commitment to providing returns to its shareholders.

data.title: Femasys grants 185,000 shares to new employees under Nasdaq Rule 5635(c)(4), making fertility & birth control accessible.
data.description: In Atlanta on February 27, 2026, Femasys Inc. revealed that they granted two new non-executive employees, who joined in February 2026, options to buy 185,000 shares of Femasys common stock. Femasys Inc., listed as FEMY on NASDAQ, is a prominent biomedical company focused on enhancing the accessibility and affordability of fertility treatments and non-surgical permanent birth control for women globally.

data.title: Prime Drink Group appoints Germain Turpin as Interim President and CEO, replacing Alexandre Côté on Feb. 28, 2026.
data.description: On February 27, 2026, Prime Drink Group Corp. (CSE: PRME) welcomed Germain Turpin as the new Interim President and CEO. Germain takes over from Alexandre Côté, who will resign on February 28, 2026. Alexandre will continue on the Board of Directors and oversee special projects.

data.title: SmartCentres REIT extends arrangements with Penguin Group, now extended to February 28, 2026 for finalization.
data.description: In a recent update, the Board of Trustees of SmartCentres Real Estate Investment Trust announced developments regarding arrangements with Mitchell Goldhar, the Trust's Executive Chairman and CEO, and owner of Penguin Group of Companies. These arrangements, initially set to expire on February 28, 2026, are being extended for further deliberation. SmartCentres, trading as SRU.UN on the TSX, is taking the necessary time to finalize these agreements with Goldhar.

data.title: Orca Energy Group Inc. halts legal action in Tanzania, according to latest announcement. #energy #Tanzania
data.description: A new report reveals that the global population has reached 7.8 billion, with Asia being the most populous continent at 4.6 billion, followed by Africa at 1.3 billion. The report also indicates that the world's urban population has surpassed 4 billion for the first time, with over half living in urban areas. Additionally, the data shows that around 3.6 billion people lack access to proper sanitation facilities, posing significant health risks. The report emphasizes the pressing need for sustainable development to address these challenges.

data.title: Edelson Lechtzin LLP investigates data breach of Pyramid Global Hospitality affecting individuals.
data.description: On February 27, 2026, based in suburban Philadelphia, the national class action law firm Edelson Lechtzin LLP announced its investigation into data privacy claims against Pyramid Advisors Limited Partnership, also known as Pyramid Global Hospitality. The firm is looking into a breach that Pyramid Global Hospitality recently discovered involving the compromised data of a large number of individuals.

data.title: Trump instructs federal agencies to remove 'woke' Anthropic AI in 6 months after Pentagon disagreement.
data.description: In response to disagreements over military security measures, President Trump has ordered all government agencies to discontinue the use of Anthropic's products within a six-month period. This decision impacts numerous agencies at the federal level and involves transitioning away from Anthropic's offerings within the specified time frame.

data.title: SOL down 72% from peak, but data suggests undervaluation. Is SOL trading at a steep discount?
data.description: The cryptocurrency SOL has experienced a significant decrease of 72% from its peak value. Despite this drop, various indicators suggest an attractive opportunity for investment. The question arises whether SOL is currently being traded at a substantial markdown.
